result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler J. Roberts

records.addlTxt:
2:28 PM Defendant Tyler J. Roberts in court.  Attorney Walter Arthur Piel Jr. in court for Tyler J. Roberts.  Attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for State of Wisconsin. Report received. Atty Piel heard; not contesting. Defendant states competent. Parties stipulate to Report. Court heard; finds incompetent per Report & Counsel; will regain within time period with treatment. Discussion on treatment. Parties agree to OCRP. Court heard; orders to outpatient/OCRP. Court sets Review.
Review hearing scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing on January 27, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Competency hearing on October 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
No contact letter from Forensic Unit

8:32 AM Defendant Tyler J. Roberts in court.  Attorney Walter Arthur Piel Jr. in court for Tyler J. Roberts.  Prosecuting attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Piel heard; raises competency. DA Klomberg heard. Court orders Competency Evaluation.

Adjustment Number: 22A 089900,
Payable Number: 244724,
Receipt Number: 22R 013035,
Amount: $20.00

ADDRESS INFO for Tyler J. Roberts
Current: 955 Willow St, Lomira, WI 53048 United States  (Effective: 08-03-2022)
Prior: 307 Washington St # 201, Horicon, WI 53032

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. Defendant shall maintain compliance with treatment plan.

1:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tyler J. Roberts appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alyssa F. George-Stifler (Eligible) appeared by video for Tyler J. Roberts. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $500.00 Cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. Defendant shall maintain compliance with treatment plan.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
